bibl.title: Aristophanes Son of Johannes: An Eighth-Century Bilingual Scribe? A Study of Graphic Bilingualism.
The Multilingual Experience in Egypt, from the Ptolemies to the Abbasids
bibl.author: CROMWELL, Jennifer

bibl.note: Paper originally presented at the XXVth International Congress of Papyrologists, Ann Arbor, 29 July - 3 August 2007. - Focuses on a neglected aspect of bilingualism, namely palaeography, and on the introduction of the notion of graphic bilingualism. The phenomenon is illustrated with a case study of the works of one scribe from the site of JÄ“me: Aristophanes son of Johannes, the scribe of 27 legal documents written on papyrus.
